House of Trees

Treehouse

06 December 2015

treehouse

Since this blog is mainly just a collection of resources I’ve been using to learn Web/Software development, I thought it would be remiss if I didn’t make a post about Treehouse. I’m normally scouring for free resources, but It’s a paid rescource and it’s worth every penny my buddy Dave pays for it.

I’m at their site on a nearly daily basis. It has an incredibly wide berth of different languages to learn. In the last week I’ve been spending time with Andrew Chalkley learning Database Foundations and brushing up on MySQL (He has great courses on Javascript and JQuery), also taking a course on Express Basics with Huston Hedinger, and Build a Blog with Jekyll and GitHub Pages with the CSS guru Guil Hernandez(He has great courses on CSS, when in doubt ask your self WWGD).
